name: Khao Tom (Thai Rice Soup Recipe)
description: This healthy soup is as easy as it is delicious, made with rice, minced pork, and light flavors.
recipeIngredient: 7 ounces pork (minced, roll up into meatballs)
green onions (to taste, slice into 1-inch sized pcs)

recipeInstructions.text: Pound garlic and coriander root with a mortar and pestle.
recipeInstructions.name: Pound garlic and coriander root with a mortar and pestle.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a wok or skillet over medium heat, add oil and fry the garlic and coriander root mixture.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat a wok or skillet over medium heat, add oil and fry the garlic and coriander root mixture.

recipeInstructions.text: When the garlic is golden and fragrant, add white pepper and white rice. Toss and mix for approx 30 seconds.
recipeInstructions.name: When the garlic is golden and fragrant, add white pepper and white rice. Toss and mix for approx 30 seconds.

recipeInstructions.text: Place a soup pot over medium heat and add water, bouillon cube, salt, and light soy sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Place a soup pot over medium heat and add water, bouillon cube, salt, and light soy sauce.

recipeInstructions.text: Bring to a boil and add the rice. Close the soup pot lid and let boil for 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Bring to a boil and add the rice. Close the soup pot lid and let boil for 10 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add celery and the pork meatballs 1 by 1 to ensure they don’t clump together. Cook for 5 more minutes, or until the pork meatballs float to the surface. Serve immediately and garnish with fresh green onions.
